document_data.name: A Traveler's Guide to Baldur's Gate
document_data.mainbody:
'''''A Traveler's Guide to Baldur's Gate''''' was a travelogue that detailed the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], published sometime before [[1492 DR]].

{{Quote|Variety is the blood of the city itself, for better or worse.|''Excerpt from A Traveler's Guide.''}}
document_data.Contents: The book spoke of the great number of services Baldur's Gate had to offer, along with the numerous lifestyles the city supported. Those who devoted themselves to the [[Faerûnian pantheon|gods of the Realms]] had many temples to visit, while those merely looking for were could find opportunity for employment all across the sprawling city. It was however the criminal element of the Gate, that was most prevalent throughout its many and varied neighborhoods.
document_data.Notable Owners: * [[Zevlor]], a former member of the [[Hellriders]] who sought to lead a group of outcast [[tieflings]] from [[Elturel]] to [[Baldur's Gate]].
